definition: insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

sentences.english: Those indifferent fold love, who is easy to.
sentences.chinese: 那些淡漠褶皺的情絲，被誰等閒的扯碎。

sentences.english: I chewed on a small bite of the bread, trying to look indifferent.
sentences.chinese: 我咬了一小口麪包，試圖讓自己的表情顯得淡漠些。

sentences.english: Even if indifference, but he was always a limitless a faith gives teared up.
sentences.chinese: 縱使淡漠無邊，卻總有一種信仰讓淚流滿面。

sentences.english: Her face was dry and pale, as though she regarded herself in the light of a murderess.
sentences.chinese: 她的臉色淡漠慘白，彷彿她把自己當成了殺人兇手。

sentences.english: At the same time, the influence of ancient mother-right society leads to the ignorance of kinship.
sentences.chinese: 同時古代母權制遺留也導致了人們對血緣的淡漠。

sentences.english: Rest on your fetters faintly, I just have no courage to admit.
sentences.chinese: 我無力的任由你擺佈，淡漠的停留在你的枷鎖你。

sentences.english: A kind of secret song is born of this indifference.
sentences.chinese: 從這淡漠中似乎滋生了一種隱祕的歌謠。

sentences.english: An attempt to preserve life in a state of neutrality and indifference, is unreasonable and vain.
sentences.chinese: 試圖保持生活的中立和淡漠，是不明智的，徒勞的。

sentences.english: Once a solemn pledge of love has been already indifferent, did two persons lead along by hand and really already go to the end?
sentences.chinese: 曾經的海誓山盟都已淡漠，兩人牽手真的已走到盡頭？

sentences.english: That invisible wall was now being cemented by the mortar of indifference.
sentences.chinese: 那無形的牆好像被淡漠的灰漿接合得更加堅固了。

sentences.english: Abulia, affective flattening, delusion and hallucination were their most common symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 多見的症狀是意志減退，情感淡漠，妄想和幻覺。

sentences.english: My mother, that evening, and its strange indifference.
sentences.chinese: 我母親，那個夜晚，還有那奇異的淡漠。

definition: cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect
as cold as ice and frost (idiom, usually of woman); icy manner/frigid
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
